channel.title: 🪴 Digital Garden on
channel.description: Recent content in 🪴 Digital Garden on

item.title: Setup
item.description: Making your own Quartz Setting up Quartz requires a basic understanding of git. If you are unfamiliar, this resource is a great place to start!

item.title: Editing Content in Quartz
item.description: Editing Quartz runs on top of Hugo so all notes are written in Markdown. Folder Structure Here’s a rough overview of what’s what.

item.title: Obsidian Vault Integration
item.description: Setup Obsidian is the preferred way to use Quartz. You can either create a new Obsidian Vault or link one that your already have.

item.title: Preview Changes
item.description: If you’d like to preview what your Quartz site looks like before deploying it to the internet, here’s exactly how to do that!

item.title: Deploying Quartz to the Web
item.description: Hosting on GitHub Pages Quartz is designed to be effortless to deploy. If you forked and cloned Quartz directly from the repository, everything should already be good to go!
Oat residue aminos (photo) Recipe: [[Koji recipes#Oat residue aminos]] 2021-10-16 Incubation procedure: 2021-10-16: 20:00 Internal start temp: 24 C. Oven start temp: 28C.
Soybean tempeh Standard dehulled soybean tempeh (2020-08-25) Test: Tempeh starter, inoculation time, inoculation method Standard recipe (according to [[Miso, Tempeh, Natto (Shockey)]]).
Tempeh experiments Different beans [[Soybean tempeh]] [[Different legumes]]
Tempeh links Images of larger-scale tempeh production (Tempehting): ![[projects/attachments/Tempeh larger scale.png]] The Book of Tempeh (1977, Google Books)

item.title: Best tempeh practice
item.description: Best tempeh practice Choice of legumes/grains “Tough” lentils (e.g. Gotland lentils) don’t make a good cake on their own, but are a good addition to other legumes that would give a too soft cake.

item.title: CJK + Latex Support (测试)
item.description: Chinese, Japanese, Korean Support 几乎在我们意识到之前，我们已经离开了地面。 우리가 그것을 알기도 전에 우리는 땅을 떠났습니다. 私たちがそれを知るほぼ前に、私たちは地面を離れていました。 Latex Block math works with two dollar signs $$.

item.title: Configuration
item.description: Configuration Quartz is designed to be extremely configurable. You can find the bulk of the configuration scattered throughout the repository depending on how in-depth you’d like to get.

item.title: Cooking tempeh
item.description: Cooking tempeh Different Swedish legumes and grains See [[Different legumes]] for how the tempeh was made Preparation: Put every sample (seperately) for 10 min into boiling water (flipping once in between).

item.title: Custom Domain
item.description: Registrar This step is only applicable if you are using a custom domain! If you are using a <YOUR-USERNAME>.github.io domain, you can skip this step.

item.title: Different legumes
item.description: Different legumes Different Indian dals (2020-09-09) Test: Chana dal, Toor dal, Green mung dal Standard recipe (according to [[Miso, Tempeh, Natto (Shockey)]]), adapted.

item.title: Dill pickles
item.description: Dill pickles ![[projects/attachments/Screenshot 2022-06-10 at 20.05.47.png]] Recipe: [[Vegetable recipes#Dill pickles]] 2022-04-20: Not as acidic and sweet as smörgåsgurkar, but still nice flavour.

item.title: Fermentation projects
item.description: Fermentation projects Vegetables fermentations [Vegetable recipes](projects/fermentation/Vegetable recipes) Dairy- and plant-based milk fermentations [Yogurt production](projects/fermentation/Yogurt production) Tempeh [Tempeh experiments](projects/fermentation/Tempeh experiments) [Tempeh links](projects/fermentation/Tempeh links)

item.title: Fermented carrot and parsley root
item.description: Fermented carrot and parsely root ![[projects/attachments/Screenshot 2022-06-10 at 20.07.38.png]] Recipe: [[Vegetable recipes#Vietnamese pickled carrot and daikon]] 2022-03: Made with parsley root instead of daikon.

item.title: Fermented vegetable production
item.description: Fermented vegetable production [[Fermented carrot and parsely root]] [[Hungarian celeriac kraut]] [[Dill pickles]]

item.title: Hungarian celeriac kraut
item.description: Hungarian celeriac kraut ![[projects/attachments/Screenshot 2022-06-10 at 20.07.12.png]] Recipe: [[Vegetable recipes#Hungarian celeriac kraut]] 2022-03: Nice mild heat from the peppers, and the fermented celeriac gets a nice sharp-acidic flavour that goes well with the celeria taste.

item.title: Ignoring Notes
item.description: Quartz Ignore Edit ignoreFiles in config.toml to include paths you’d like to exclude from being rendered. 1 2 3 4 5 6 .

item.title: Koji recipes
item.description: What koji needs From https://www.fermentationculture.eu/what-koji-needs/ Temperature: ==28-36C==. At lower temperatures: more proteases, at higher temperatures: more amylases. Relative humidity: 90% Spray with water if necessary

item.title: Quartz Philosophy
item.description: “[One] who works with the door open gets all kinds of interruptions, but [they] also occasionally gets clues as to what the world is and what might be important.

item.title: Troubleshooting and FAQ
item.description: Still having trouble? Here are a list of common questions and problems people encounter when installing Quartz. While you’re here, join our Discord :)

item.title: Updating
item.description: Haven’t updated Quartz in a while and want all the cool new optimizations? On Unix/Mac systems you can run the following command for a one-line update!

item.title: Vegetable recipes
item.description: Vegetable recipes Sauerkraut Mama’s Sauerkraut (Tupperware) 10kg gehobeltes Kraut 80g Salz (= 8g/kg) 200g Milchzucker Kümmel, Wacholder Gut mischen bis Saft entsteht.
